intro: Brickellia cavanillesii, commonly known as the Mexican brickellbush, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually gray-green and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range from yellow to orange in color. Brickellia cavanillesii is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
